name: Jan-Daksha Trust

address: 56, Paneri Upwan, Gali No.2, near Bikaner Misthan Bhandar, Bedla Road, Udaipur-313001

briefDescription: When one talks of labour immediately in mind pops-up the image of a man working under the scorching sun. Unfortunately that is not the case women labor workforce has rampantly increased in the last decade but government has not been doing much to provide them the basic facilities of social security, health, water, education and safety. A whole family gets involved in a profession if a women gets engaged in the labor, directly or indirectly. Her health is directly connected to the child's health and family's economy.Through its center "Shramik Sahayta Evam Sandarbha Kendra". 11,352 migrant labors have been registered in the organization and gets constant support from us. Through its programme jadaksha have been able to serve 2400 migrant labors and provide services on the following:•	Minimum Wages.•	Minimum work hours.•	Social Security.•	Legal Advice.•	Health.* Dispute Settlement.* Linkage with Social Security Schemes, Labour Welfare Schemes, NPS Schemes.* Providing network between youth and Skill Development Trainings.
